contentList.content: Circle of the Shepherd
Druids of the Circle of the Shepherd commune with the spirits of nature, especially the spirits of beasts and the fey, and call to those spirits for aid.
Speech of the Woods
You have the ability to comprehend and communicate with animals.
The Druid has the ability to comprehend and communicate with animals.
Summon Spirit Totem

Summon an incorporeal spirit totem that takes the shape of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SpiritTotemBear">Bear</LSTag>, a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SpiritTotemHawk">Hawk</LSTag>, or a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SpiritTotemStag">Stag</LSTag>, and grants you and your allies benefits depending on the type of totem you summon.
Spirit Totem: Bear

Summon an incorporeal bear totem that grants you and your allies its might and endurance. The spirit grants allies [1] within [2] of where it appears, and you and your allies gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SkillChecks">Checks</LSTag> and Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> while in the spirit totem's aura.
Aura of the Mighty Bear

The bear spirit grants the Druid and its allies gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SkillChecks">Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> while in the spirit totem's aura.
Bear's Might

Has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SkillChecks">Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> while in the spirit totem's aura.
Bear's Fortitude
A Shepherd Druid's Bear Spirit totem has gifted this entity with <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to 5 + the Druid's level.
Move Spirit Totem: Bear Spirit
Move the Bear Spirit Totem up to [1].
Spirit Totem: Hawk

Summon an incorporeal hawk totem that aids you and your allies with its keen sight. The spirit grants allies <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SkillChecks">Checks</LSTag> while in the spirit totem's aura, and you can grant yourself or an ally <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against a target standing in the aura.
Aura of the Consummate Hawk

The hawk spirit grants the Druid and its allies <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SkillChecks">Checks</LSTag> while in the spirit totem's aura, and allows the Druid to grant themselves or an ally <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against a target standing in the aura.
Hawk's Sight

Whenever an ally of the Shepherd Druid makes an attack against an enemy within the aura, the Druid can grant <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on the <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>. Also has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SkillChecks">Checks</LSTag>.
Hawk's Piercing Gaze
Whenever the Shepherd Druid or their ally makes an attack against this enemy, the Druid may grant <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on the <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
Grant <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against an enemy within the spirit totem's aura.
Spirit Totem: Hawk: Advantage on Attack
Spirit Totem: Stag

Summon an incorporeal stag spirit totem that lends it protection to you and your allies, granting the ability to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SPIRIT_TOTEM_STAG_SEE_INVISIBILITY">sense hidden creatures</LSTag> and objects while within the spirit totem's aura. In addition, if you cast a spell using a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> that restores <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, you may cause all allies in the aura to regain hit points equal to your Druid level.
You can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> to move the spirit up to [1].
Aura of the Guardian Stag

The stag spirit grants the Druid and its allies the ability to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SPIRIT_TOTEM_STAG_SEE_INVISIBILITY">see invisible creatures</LSTag> and objects in the spirit totem's aura. Furthermore, whenever the Druid casts a healing spell, the Druid may cause each of its allies within the aura to regain health equal to the Druid's level.
Spirit Totem: Stag: See Invisibility
The Shepherd's stag spirit blesses this this entity with the ability to see invisible creatures and objects.
Spirit Totem: Stag: Bonus Heal
Whenever the Shepherd Druid heals a target, they may cause each ally within the spirit totem's aura to regain <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">health</LSTag> equal to the Druid's level.
Heal each ally within the Spirit Totem: Stag's aura for an amount equal to your Druid level.
You may heal each ally within the Spirit Totem: Stag's aura for an amount equal to your Druid level.
Can only be used after casting a spell using a spell slot that restores hit points.
Mighty Summoner

Beasts and fey that you conjure are more resilient than normal. When casting a spell that summons a beast or fey, it gains increased <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">health</LSTag> and its natural weapons are considered magical, overcoming <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> towards non-magical damage.
Summoned by a Shepherd Druid. Has increased <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">health</LSTag>, and its natural weapons overcome <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> towards non-magical damage.
Guardian Spirit

Your Spirit Totem safeguards the beasts and fey that you call forth with your magic. When a beast or fey that you summoned ends its turn in your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SpiritTotem">Spirit Totem</LSTag> aura, that creature regains <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> equal to half your Druid level.
Guardian Spirit Heal
When a beast or fey summoned by the Shepherd Druid ends its turn in your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SpiritTotem">Spirit Totem</LSTag> aura, it regains [1].
Summon Beast
Call forth a wolf or raven spirit to aid you in your travels.
Summon Beast: Wolf
Call forth a wolf spirit with increased combat prowess when near its allies.
Summon Beast: Raven
Call forth a raven spirit that can easily move about the battlefield.
Flyby
Maul
Maul the target.
Jab
Jab the target with your beak.
Summon Beast Bonuses
Conjure Animals
Summon fey beasts to aid you, taking the shape of a Saber-Toothed Tiger, a Polar Bear, or a Giant Eagle.
Conjure Polar Bear
Conjure a mighty Polar Bear to aid you in your travels.
Conjure Dilophosaurus
Conjure an imposing Dilophosaurus to aid you in your travels.
Conjure Saber-Toothed Tiger
Conjure a cunning Saber-Toothed Tiger to aid you in your travels.
Conjure Giant Eagles
Conjure two swift Giant Eagles to aid you in your travels.
Conjure Polar Bears
Conjure two mighty Polar Bears to aid you in your travels.
Conjure Dilophosauruses
Conjure two imposing Dilophosauruses to aid you in your travels.
Conjure Saber-Toothed Tigers
Conjure two cunning Saber-Toothed Tigers to aid you in your travels.
Conjures four swift Giant Eagles to aid you in your travels.
Lunge at a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> target's throat.
Leap at a target, striking it with your claws and knocking it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Keen Smell
Has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SkillChecks">Checks</LSTag> due to its keen senses.
Summon Fey

Call forth a fey spirit with a chosen mood: <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SUMMON_FEY_FUMING">Fuming</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SUMMON_FEY_MIRTHFUL">Mirthful</LSTag>, or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SUMMON_FEY_TRICKSY">Tricksy</LSTag>. The spirit has different spells available depending on the chosen mood.
Summon Fey: Fuming
Call forth a frenzied fey spirit that channels its rage in melee combat.

This summoned fey is furious. After using its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FeyStep_Fuming">Fey Step</LSTag> ability, it has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on its next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
Summon Fey: Mirthful
Call forth a delightful fey spirit able to charm enemies.
This summoned fey is positively captivating. After using its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FeyStep_Mirthful">Fey Step</LSTag> ability, it can charm a nearby enemy.
Summon Fey: Tricksy
Call forth a mischievous fey spirit able to call forth patches of darkness.

This summoned fey is up to something. When using its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FeyStep_Tricksy">Fey Step</LSTag> ability, it can create a patch of darkness that lasts until the end of its next turn.
Fey Step: Fuming
Teleport to an unoccupied space you can see. Afterwards, get <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
Fuming Advantage
Has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
Fey Step: Mirthful
Teleport to an unoccupied space you can see. Afterwards, you can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MirthfulCharm">charm</LSTag> an enemy.
Fey Step: Tricksy
Teleport to an unoccupied space you can see. Afterwards, you can create a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Darkness_Tricksy">patch of darkness</LSTag> that lasts until the end of your next turn.
Fey Slash
Aim an attack at a target.
Deals extra damage equal to the spell slot level used to cast the summon spell.
Summon Fey Bonuses
Tricksy Darkness
Create a small patch of darkness.
Can create a small patch of darkness.
Mirthful Charm
Can charm a nearby enemy.
Charmed by a fey spirit.
Charms a nearby enemy, preventing it from attacking you.
Conjure Woodland Beings
Summon a fey creature taking the shape of a dryad or a meenlock to fight alongside you.
Conjure Woodland Beings: Dryad
Conjure Woodland Beings: Meenlock

Conjure a meenlock to fight alongside you. It can <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">paralyze</LSTag> creatures with its venomous claws, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShadowTeleport_Meenlock">teleport</LSTag> to a shadowy location, and possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MEENLOCK_FEAR_AURA">frighten</LSTag> nearby enemies.
Lash out with venomous claws to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED_MEENLOCK">Paralyze</LSTag> your target.
The creature can repeat the <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> at the end of each of its turns, ending the paralysis on a success.
Casting this spell at a higher level increases the beast's armor class, hit points and damage done.
Using a 5th-level spell slot or higher to cast this spell doubles the number of summoned beasts.
Casting this spell at a higher level increases the fey's armor class, hit points and damage done.
Bear Spirit Totem
Hawk Spirit Totem
Stag Spirit Totem
Fey Spirit
Can possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frighten</LSTag> nearby enemies with its fey presence.
Summon Beast: Multiattack
Can make a number of attacks equal to the spell level used to summon the beast, rounded down.
Summon Fey: Multiattack
Can make a number of attacks equal to the spell level used to summon the fey, rounded down.
